title: Extinction Models in R
text: package includes many extinction models published ecology palaeontology literature. still active development.

title: Extinction Models in R
code: ## install and load devtools (if needed) install.packages("devtools") # if not already installed library(devtools)  ## install dodo from GitHub and load install_github("Louis-Backstrom/dodo") library(dodo)

title: Extinction Models in R
code: ## access list of package functions ?dodo  ## explore monk seal sightings dataset from Solow 1993a monk_seal  ## fit the monk seal model from Solow 1993a SO93F1(monk_seal, alpha = 0.05, init.time = 1915, test.time = 1992)

title: Extinction Models in R
text: Certain functions package require JAGS (accessed via rjags) BUGS (via R2OpenBUGS). installed prior running functions incorporate Gibbs sampling.

title: Extinction Models in R

title: Bradshaw et al.'s (2012)
text: Equation 4 Bradshaw et al. 2012. Estimates point estimate time extinction.

title: Bradshaw et al.'s (2012)
text: records sighting records ccon format (see convert_dodo details). alpha desired significance level (defaults \(\alpha = 0.05\)) use underlying McInerny et al. 2006 model.

title: Bradshaw et al.'s (2012)
text: list object original parameters point estimate included elements.

title: Bradshaw et al.'s (2012)
text: sighting records assumed certain sampling effort assumed constant. Gaussian-resampled model (GRIWM) also presented Bradshaw et al. 2012 (incorporates radiometric dating error). Duplicate sightings single time unit discarded.

title: Bradshaw et al.'s (2012)
text: Key Reference Bradshaw, C. J. ., Cooper, ., Turney, C. S. M., & Brook, B. W. (2012). Robust estimates extinction time geological record. Quaternary Science Reviews, 33, 14-19. doi:10.1016/j.quascirev.2011.11.021 References McInerny, G. J., Roberts, D. L., Davy, . J., & Cribb, P. J. (2006). Significance sighting rate inferring extinction threat. Conservation Biology, 20(2), 562-567. doi:10.1111/j.1523-1739.2006.00377.x

title: Brook et al.'s (2019)
text: Solow 1993a variant model Brook et al. 2019. Estimates "probability" extinction test time, two-sided \(1 - \alpha\) confidence interval point estimate time extinction. Sighting uncertainty incorporated.

title: Brook et al.'s (2019)
code: BR19F1(   records,   alpha = 0.05,   test.time = as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")),   cores = NULL,   n.iter = 10000 )

title: Brook et al.'s (2019)
text: records sighting records ucon format (see convert_dodo details). alpha desired significance level (defaults \(\alpha = 0.05\)) \(1 - \alpha\) confidence interval. test.time end observation period, typically present day (defaults current year). cores number cores use (defaults NULL, case parallel::detectCores() run). n.iter number iterations run (defaults 10,000).

title: Brook et al.'s (2019)
text: list object original parameters probability, point estimate, confidence interval included elements. confidence interval two-element numeric vector called conf.int.

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
text: Constant population model Caley & Barry 2014. Estimates posterior probability species extant test time, point estimate one-sided \(1 - \alpha\) credible interval time extinction.

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
code: CB14B1(   records,   alpha = 0.05,   init.time,   test.time = init.time + length(records) - 1,   n.iter = 1e+05 )

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
text: records sighting records cbin format (see convert_dodo details). alpha desired threshold level (defaults \(\alpha = 0.05\)) \(1 - \alpha\) credible interval. init.time start observation period. test.time time point retrospectively calculate extinction probability . Defaults end observation period. n.iter number iterations run (defaults 100,000).

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
text: list object original parameters p(extant), point estimate, credible interval included elements. credible interval two-element numeric vector called cred.int.

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
text: sighting records assumed certain sampling effort assumed constant.

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
text: Key Reference Caley, P., & Barry, S. C. (2014). Quantifying extinction probabilities sighting records: inference uncertainties. PLoS One, 9(4), e95857. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0095857

title: Caley & Barry's (2014)
code: # Run the fox analysis from Caley & Barry 2014 CB14B1(fox, init.time = 2001, test.time = 2012) #> $records #>  [1] 1 0 1 0 1 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 #>  #> $alpha #> [1] 0.05 #>  #> $init.time #> [1] 2001 #>  #> $test.time #> [1] 2012 #>  #> $n.iter #> [1] 1e+05 #>  #> $p.extant #> [1] 0.06178 #>  #> $estimate #> [1] 2007 #>  #> $cred.int #> [1] 2007 2015 #>  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run an example analysis using the Slender-billed Curlew data CB14B1(curlew$cbin, init.time = 1817) } # }

title: Lee's (2014)
text: simple numerical tool presented Lee 2014, including uncertain sightings surveys. Estimates posterior probability species extant end observation period.

title: Lee's (2014)
code: LE14B1(records, surveys, threshold = 0.9, prior = c(0, 1), n.iter = 10000)

title: Lee's (2014)
text: records sighting records iucn format (see convert_dodo details). surveys survey effort data (passive survey effort ignored). data.frame 11 columns: time, survey, epsilon, epsilon_lower, epsilon_upper, p_i, p_i_lower, p_i_upper, p_r, p_r_lower, p_r_upper. number rows must match records. threshold cutoff certainty value sightings consider certain. Defaults 0.9. prior two-element numeric vector lower upper bounds (uniform) prior extant (P(X_T)). Defaults c(0, 1). n.iter number iterations run (defaults 10,000).

title: Lee's (2014)
text: list object original parameters p(extant) included elements.

title: Lee's (2014)

text: records sighting records ubin format (see convert_dodo details). Defaults 0.01, following original code Solow & Beet 2014. gamma parameter exponential prior. Defaults 1. record.check uncertain sightings prior final certain sighting. Three options: error (default, throws error), remove (problematic sightings removed data), coerce (problematic sightings treated certain sightings).

title: Weiss & Marshall's (1999)
text: records sighting records cbin format (see convert_dodo details). surveys numeric vector survey times observation records. alpha desired threshold level (defaults \(\alpha = 0.05\)) \(1 - \alpha\) credible interval. test.time time point retrospectively calculate extinction probability . Defaults time final survey. priors list three elements: lambda, c d. lambda mean lifetime (half-life) exponential prior S, time extinction. c d two shape parameters beta prior pi, pre-extinction detection probability. increment step size used integration. Defaults 0.001.

title: Convert basic sightings spreadsheet into all dodo formats — convert_dodo
code: convert_dodo(   x,   init.time,   test.time = as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")),   threshold = 0.9,   unique = TRUE,   aggregate = "pci_prod",   time,   certainty,   certainty_lower,   certainty_upper )

title: Convert basic sightings spreadsheet into all dodo formats — convert_dodo
text: x sightings spreadsheet converted. Must data.frame requisite columns included. See Table S1 Buchanan et al. (2025) example. init.time start observation period. test.time end observation period, typically present day (defaults current year). threshold cutoff certainty value sightings consider certain (binary certain/uncertain models). Defaults 0.9. unique whether deduplicate dataset (mitigate nonidependence issues). Defaults TRUE, case dataset grouped every column except time, recent row kept group. aggregate function use aggregating records iucn format. Default "pci_prod", returns \(1 - \prod(1 - x)\) \(x\) vector certainty values time step. sensible functions include "min, "mean", "max". time name column time values. certainty name column certainty values. certainty_lower name column certainty lower bound values. certainty_upper name column certainty upper bound values.

title: Convert basic sightings spreadsheet into all dodo formats — convert_dodo
text: list object 11 elements: original parameters init.time, test.time, threshold, unique, 7 converted datasets.

title: Convert basic sightings spreadsheet into all dodo formats — convert_dodo
text: ccon: continuous certain sightings. simplest format, vector (certain) sighting times taxon interest. See e.g. SO93F1. cbin: binary certain sightings. vector 0/1 (certain) sighting states discrete (integer) time intervals init.time test.time taxon interest. Similar ccon, note multiple records interval collapse 1. See e.g. CB14B1. cdis: discrete certain sightings. vector (certain) sighting counts discrete (integer) time intervals init.time test.time taxon interest. Similar cbin, note multiple records interval collapse 1. See e.g. BU95F1. ucon: continuous uncertain sightings. data.frame sighting times taxon interest, certainty scores 0 1 associated record. See e.g. JR14F1. ubin: binary uncertain sightings. data.frame two columns, first vector 0/1 certain sighting states discrete (integer) time intervals init.time test.time taxon interest, second equivalent vector uncertain sightings. See e.g. KO20B2. umcd: multi-class discrete uncertain sightings. data.frame sighting counts discrete (integer) time intervals init.time test.time taxon interest. Sightings split classes based certainty score. See e.g. TH13B1. iucn: IUCN-format sightings. data.frame sighting certainty (\(p(ci)\)) bounds (lower upper) discrete (integer) time intervals init.time test.time taxon interest. multiple sightings single time interval, assumed independent one another overall \(p(ci)\) score period defined \(1 - \prod 1 - p(ci)\). See e.g. TH17I1.

title: Convert basic sightings spreadsheet into all dodo formats — convert_dodo
code: # Convert the raw Slender-billed Curlew data convert_dodo(   x = curlew_raw, init.time = 1817, test.time = 2022, threshold = 0.9,   unique = TRUE, aggregate = "pci_prod", time = "year", certainty = "p_ci",   certainty_lower = "p_ci_min", certainty_upper = "p_ci_max" ) #> Error in if (class(x) != "data.frame") {    stop("Sightings spreadsheet must be a data.frame object!")}: the condition has length > 1

title: dodo: Extinction Models in R — dodo
text: SL88F1() Springer & Lilje's (1988) "Broken Stick" model. SS89F1() Strauss & Sadler's (1989) "Classical" model. SS89B1() Strauss & Sadler's (1989) "Bayesian" model. SO93F1() Solow's (1993) "Classical" model. SO93B1() Solow's (1993) "Bayesian" model. SO93F2() Solow's (1993) "Declining" model. MA94F1() Marshall's (1994) "Distribution-free" model. BU95F1() Burgman et al.'s (1995) "Discrete-time" model. BU95F2() Burgman et al.'s (1995) "Runs Test" model. BU95F3() Burgman et al.'s (1995) "Empty Cells" model. MA97F1() Marshall's (1997) "Non-random" model. MC98F1() McCarthy's (1998) "Partial Solow" model. MC99F1() McFarlane's (1999) "Median Gap" model. WM99B1() Weiss & Marshall's (1999) "Discrete-time" model. RS03F1() Roberts & Solow's (2003) "Optimal Linear Estimation" model. SR03F1() Solow & Roberts' (2003) "Non-parametric" model. MC06F1() McInerny et al.'s (2006) "Sighting Rate" model. RO09B1() Rout et al.'s (2009) "Declining" model. JE10F1() Jarić & Ebenhard's (2010) "Stationary" model. JE10F2() Jarić & Ebenhard's (2010) "Non-stationary" model. BR12F1() Bradshaw et al.'s (2012) "Inverse-weighted McInerny" model. SO12B1() Solow et al.'s (2012) "Uncertain" model. TH13B1() Thompson et al.'s (2013) "Deterministic" model. TH13B2() Thompson et al.'s (2013) "Quenched" model. TH13B3() Thompson et al.'s (2013) "Annealed" model. AL14B1() Alroy's (2015) "Creeping Shadow Doubt" model. CB14B1() Caley & Barry's (2014) "Constant" model. CB14B2() Caley & Barry's (2014) "Non-constant" model. JR14F1() Jarić & Roberts' (2014) "Solow" model. LE14B1() Lee's (2014) "Simple" model. LE14B2() Lee et al.'s (2014) "Variable Reliability" model. SB14B1() Solow & Beet's (2014) "Model 1" model. SB14B2() Solow & Beet's (2014) "Model 2" model. AL15B1() Alroy's (2015) "Agnostic" model. SO16B1() Solow's (2016) "Retrospective" model. SO16B2() Solow's (2016) "Sequential" model. WA16B1()	Wang et al.'s (2016) "Adaptive" model. TH17I1() Thompson et al.'s (2017) "Iterative" model. BR19F1() Brook et al.'s (2019) "Solow" model. BR19F2() Brook et al.'s (2019) "Solow & Roberts" model. BR19F3() Brook et al.'s (2019) "Roberts & Solow" model. BR19F4() Brook et al.'s (2019) "McInerny" model. BR19F5() Brook et al.'s (2019) "Last Appearance Date" model. TH19B1() Thompson et al.'s (2017) "Bayesian Updating" model. KO20B1() Kodikara et al.'s (2020) "Certain-" model. KO20B2() Kodikara et al.'s (2020) "Uncertain" model. KO21B1() Kodikara et al.'s (2021) "Change-point" model.
